intro: Ononis hircina f. spinescens, commonly known as the spiny bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit and produces small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant features numerous spines along its stems, which are a distinguishing feature of this form. It thrives in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. The leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its overall rugged appearance.
